page.title: 05NETTLETON-AN OVERVIEW
page.content: Unlike many villages in this area Nettleton has grown over the last 30 years in terms of population and housing.Some of the inhabitants work in the large towns nearby,Grimsby and Scunthorpe as well as the smaller market towns of Brigg,Caistor and Market Rasen.The population has increased from 469 in 1951 to approx. 640 in 1977.Although the rate of housing growth is slow there are five new bungalows being erected in Cooks Lane.The range of facilities in the village is limited but residents are in easy reach of those in Caistor and local transport can take them to the larger towns nearby.The main sources of local employment were farming and mining but the mine has closed and employment in agriculture is on the decline and most villagers commute to work.
